attributes.action: I want all UK citizens to get a vote on Scotland`s future as part of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
First vote statistics - No to Independence 2,001,926 votes against pro independence 1,617,989 votes.
First referendum in 2014 was described by Alex Salmond as "once in a lifetime opportunity" yet again within three years they are looking for another vote.  How many more are they going to want.
John Cridland of the CBI said the first referendum damaged the UK economy.
Why should all of the UK suffer and do we really want Scotland to continue to be a burden to us.  Lets force them to leave.
attributes.background: Scottish Parliament voted for another referendum on independence.  The previous referendum caused uncertainty within business and the economic markets which impacted upon all UK citizens.  All UK citizens other than the Scots should vote as to whether we want Scotland to be part of the UK future.
